Description: Semi circular artificial eye in stone with a black round dot to mark the iris placed on the top half of the piece. Object is formed of at least three fragments. Red dots are visible at each corner of the eye, and a black band is running along the edge. Consistent layer of black deposit visible at the back. Both side are nicely polished and flat. The eye would have originally been placed on the orbit of a mummified individual.
Curator's comments: Published in: P.H.K. Gray, 'Artificia eyes in mummies', JEA 57 (1971) , pl3rdXXIV (2nd row, first from the right of fig. 1)
